sentences.english: "Your lecture is called 'From Satori to Silicon Valley, ' " he explained.
sentences.chinese: “你的讲座叫做‘从禅悟到硅谷’，”他解释道。

sentences.english: Juts a joke, don't get too serious.
sentences.chinese: 一篇在硅谷盛传的笑话，你以为你老板在想啥？

sentences.english: Risk taking and reinvention are central to Silicon Valley.
sentences.chinese: 承担风险和再创造是硅谷的核心所在。

sentences.english: He also hob-nobbed with executives from Google and other Silicon Valley companies.
sentences.chinese: 他还和来自谷歌和其他硅谷公司的高管亲切交谈。

sentences.english: The business world has always been a cauldron of personal animosity, and those animosities have been particularly intense in Silicon Valley.
sentences.chinese: 商业世界从来就不缺个人恩怨，在硅谷尤其如此。

sentences.english: Mr. Pinto is a well-known figure in Silicon Valley in his own right.
sentences.chinese: 平托先生依靠他自身的能力，在硅谷有一定名气。

sentences.english: Marini says that choosing to relocate to Silicon Valley was essential to Logitech's success.
sentences.chinese: 马尼尼说搬迁至硅谷是罗技成功的关键。

sentences.english: Silicon Valley turned into an unstoppable force of innovation.
sentences.chinese: 至此，硅谷的创新潮流已经势不可挡。

sentences.english: And I talk to another executive in the Valley.
sentences.chinese: 我和硅谷的另一位主管谈话。

sentences.english: The Silicon Valley legend will become chairman of the firm.
sentences.chinese: 这这位硅谷的传奇人物将会成为公司的主席。

sentences.english: So there are partial versions of that happening.
sentences.chinese: 所以那里正在局部地出现硅谷现象。

sentences.english: It has long been fashionable for Silicon Valley visionaries to prognosticate about the direction of technology.
sentences.chinese: 硅谷的想象者预测了技术的发展方向流行了好长时间。

sentences.english: But it's not an easy task. Silicon Valley is very unique.
sentences.chinese: 但这并不容易，硅谷是独一无二的。

sentences.english: In Silicon Valley, copyright and patent infringement suits are a dime a dozen.
sentences.chinese: 在硅谷，侵犯版权和专利诉讼案件数不胜数。

sentences.english: At some point, there may be a Chinese Silicon Valley.
sentences.chinese: 在某个时点，或许会出现一个“中国硅谷”。

sentences.english: And you have the Silicon Valley boom.
sentences.chinese: 现在有了一片繁荣的硅谷。

definition: Google, Internet company and search engine

pinyin: Ka3 nei4 ji1 Mei2 long2 Da4 xue2

definition: Wall Street, New York/by extension, American big business
Kai-Fu Lee (1961-), Taiwanese computer scientist and IT executive, founding president of Google China 2005-2009
Mark Zuckerberg (1984-), American computer programer, co-founder and CEO of Facebook
